8248F168126F47679A54EEE177758F7C.description: Aggregate Supply and Aggregate Demand Achievement Standard: Analyze how the U.S. economy functions as a whole and describe selected macroeconomic measures of economic activity.

83FDA693374E4DBEB315ADC8B29B61BF.description: Global Economic Concepts Achievement Standard: Examine the role of trade, protectionism, and monetary markets in the global economy.

AEE8BA3C967C47648EA8910BF3A2D6ED.description: The Role Of Government Achievement Standard: Analyze the role of government in economic systems, especially the role of government in the U.S. economy.

703CEECF8B2D4FA2B89D6D1D3162204B.description: Productivity Achievement Standard: Explain the importance of productivity and analyze how specialization, division of labor, investment in physical and human capital, and technological change affect productivity and global trade.

C4DE56A18AAB438F88FA6E87B4243E15.description: Market Structures Achievement Standard: Analyze the different types of market structures and the effect they have on the price and the quality of the goods and services produced.

B9A2EF0A5EDB40F0A907D11393574597.description: Markets and Prices Achievement Standard: Analyze the role of markets and prices in the U.S. economy.

ECA2B700348F402C903280747899348E.description: Economic Institutions and Incentives Achievement Standard: Analyze the role of core economic institutions and incentives in the U.S. economy.

ACFF7E61E7624E73AA84B7195DD811DC.description: Economic Systems Achievement Standard: Explain why societies develop economic systems, identify the basic features of different economic systems, and analyze the major features of the U.S. economic system.

51983DC110F040AF83D913F45CAC5AFA.description: Allocation of Resources Achievement Standard: Assess opportunity costs and trade-offs involved in making choices about how to use scarce economic resources.
